page.title: 08South Lakeland Nurseries
page.content: The site of the Nursery was a field called Bowridge.The Taylor family have lived here since 1924 and the Nursery was started in 1947. It covers an area of about one acre and is mostly covered in glass houses. Large oil burners are used to heat the nursery, especially in winter.In the summer the wasps and bees are allowed to fly in and out. Over 2000 plants are sold each week. Some are grown from seed, others are brought in as young plants from other nurseries in Britain or overseas.Cut flowers are also sold as bouquets, sprays or as arrangements for hotels and functions. The Taylor family have seven people working in the Nursery or in their small Cafe next door. The Nursery may be expanded and improved in the near future.
